channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump turns on former ally Marjorie Taylor Greene as Epstein questions mount – as it happened
item.description: This live blog is now closed. Trump news at a glance: Pam Bondi announces investigation into Trump’s adversaries’ ties to Jeffrey Epstein The US trade...

item.title: Russia increasingly targeting trains as attacks on Ukraine’s rail network intensify
item.description: Ukrainian minister says more than 800 attacks recorded since start of year as Moscow seeks to destroy country’s logistical capabilities Ukraine has re...

item.title: China advises against travel to Japan amid escalating row over PM’s Taiwan comments
item.description: Sanae Takaichi says the use of force against Taiwan could warrant a military response from Tokyo China has advised its citizens to avoid travelling to...

item.title: Australia welcomes Trump’s removal of tariffs on beef and other food imports
item.description: ‘We maintain our position that tariffs on any Australian products are unjustified,’ trade minister Don Farrell says Get our breaking news email , free...

item.title: UK warned that 15% cut to health fund will force ‘impossible choices’ on Africa
item.description: Advocates fear that other donors will follow Britain’s reduction to the Global Fund for Aids, TB and malaria The UK is undermining its legacy in fight...

item.title: The Papers: 'Panic at No 10' and investors 'lose faith' in Budget
item.description: Signs that the chancellor has backtracked on plans to raise income tax dominate Saturday's newspapers.

item.title: Trump says he will take legal action against BBC after apology
item.description: The US president confirmed he intends to sue the broadcaster for at least $1bn over the Panorama edit of a 2021 speech.

item.title: After 'insane drama' of pub quiz cheating scandal, can you get the questions right?
item.description: The weekly pub quiz at the Barking Dog in Urmston returns after a cheating team was rumbled.

item.title: China urges citizens not to visit Japan over Taiwan row
item.description: Japanese PM Sanae Takaichi had suggested Tokyo could take military action if Beijing attacked Taiwan.

item.title: More rain forecast for Saturday before cold snap hits UK
item.description: Flooding and downpours will be replaced by freezing temperatures in parts of the UK from Monday.
